review_blob: Fantastic IPA from the guys at toolshed. Love everything about this beer from the aroma to the colour to the taste - massive hops and grapefruit off the top with outstanding bitterness and a smooth finish. Great balance on the hops and IBU is perfect.

Bottle 650ml ex liquor store. Definitely a different north west IPA - bitterness is there without much flavour to support. A bit too bitter to be honest and not really worth it as the hops dont come through and the malt is non-existent.

IPAs are my favorite. Phillips Amnesiac is my favorite double, and this seasonal anniversary IPA is clearly a step above even that. Pours a light blond with a small head (maybe the best head your ever had) and initial cloudiness that dissipates quickly into a clear, bright honey color. Taste is massive on the hops with 111 IBUs of raw power tempered by a touch of malt with citrus and pine galore. Unbelievable.
wicked IPA. Beautiful colour, small head but big taste - slightly citrus with clean, long lasting finish.
a good beer - great mouthfeel, aroma and initial taste but a bit too much lingering bitterness at the finish.

A great light, light beer. Flavour is not compromised and while its a matter of taste, if you like Becks, Heinecken, or Stella but dont want the calories this is the beer for you. Slightly skunky with a clean slightly hoppy flavour distinguish this beer among light beers.

Wonderful for a basic IPA. Very few in its class can match this beer for quality, consistency and hoppiness. Flavour is hoppy with hints of citrus and floral overtones. Nice smooth finish. Medium carbonation and IBU (50).

Bottle from Calgary Coop in Wentworth.  Outstanding IIPA. Well balanced hop for a DIPA with IBU that must be in the 90s. This beer is smooth yet powerful with huge flavour of sweet pine that lingers but not too long. Great finish that leave one wanting more - and at 650ml one can only have so many!

Bottle poured slightly cloudy pale golden color with smallish head. Aroma of berry -not much of the pepper. Taste is refreshing - some berries and malt with a very mild hops (IBU cant be more than 20). Clean finish and overall, a nice refreshing beer.
beer_name: Ambers Australian Mountain Pepper Berry Lager

review_blob: Outstanding. Citra is what it claims to be - but not to the exclusion of what we want in an IPA. The citrus is mild and compliments the hops perfectly. Bitterness is not overwhelming - not sure of the IBU rating but I would put it at 60-70. Delightfully bold but smooth.
